loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 35-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosita has a seafood vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Rosita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seafood to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seafood to sell

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus works hard to support her family. Venus has a live-in partner and has a coconut vending business in the Philippines.

Venus requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years now.

Venus would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jonaisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jonaisa works hard to support her family. She has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from furniture making. Jonaisa is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her buy and sell fruits and vegetables business.

Jonaisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Lydia has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, etc. for her business.

Eliflor has been in this business for 12 years now, and she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, etc. for her business

She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Florencia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her nipa roofing business.

Florencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Freciosa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

Rocelyn has been in this business for four years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

She has been raising livestock for 3 years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to repair and renovate her family home.

Ma. Mira is 42 years old and married. She has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Ma. Mira has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income froml fish and rice retailing.

Ma. Mira aspires to save money to expand her business.

Eldina is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eldina is 56-years-old and has one child who is in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Eldina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell such as candies, bread, soft drinks, etc.

Eldina has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Eldina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as candies, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma works hard to support her family. Guillerma is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

Guillerma has been in this business for one year now. In the future, Guillerma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a booklet and stationary design business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her booklet and stationary design.

She has been in this business for five years. Janet earns more income from food vending.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her booklet and stationary design

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 26 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 47-years-old and married with ten children. With five children in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, chips, bread, soap, etc.

Lorna has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, chips, bread, soap, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 69-years-old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF iin order to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Rosita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 47 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and to pay laborers' salaries for weeding her banana plantation. Cecilia has been farming bananas for 4 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay laborers' salaries for weeding her banana plantation.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Dolly works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. 

Dolly is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business. Dolly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 59 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. 

Dominga is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers for her farm. Dominga has been farming coconut for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 32 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, sugar, rice, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Adela has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and earns additional income from farming coconut.

Adela aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, sugar, rice, eggs, shampoo, and groceries to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 63 years old and married.  

Alicia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Alicia requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and raising pigs. Alicia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc for her food vending business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Camila is a 49-year-old married woman and has six children. Two of her children are currently in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Camila has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Camila requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Camila has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Camila  would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business. Arlyn has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from fish vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 41 years old and single.  

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell, like snack foods, biscuits, candies, detergent soap, and cooking oil.

Josefina has been in this business for four years and she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, detergent soap, and cooking oil. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, like snack foods, biscuits, candies, detergent soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Merlinda has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Merlinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Anacleta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Anacleta is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Anacleta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 45 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, sugar, soap and other groceries.

Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mary Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, sugar, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Saira

texts.en:
Ma. Saira is 49 years old, married and has five children, three of her children are in school.

Ma. Saira is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Saira requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Saira has been raising pigs for 18 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Saira would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cheryl has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from E-Loading (mobile prepaid load).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a soft drinks retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Gina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of soft drinks to resell. 

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Judy

Judy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Judy has been in this business for one year.

Judy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Rosefe

Rosefe has been raising pigs for 16 years, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Junabelle has been in this business for 10 years. Junabelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Rosalie requested a PHP 23,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

Apolonia has been in this business for 20 years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Lourdesita

Lourdesita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets and gear for her business. Lourdesita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Lucena

Lucena is 61 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Lucena works very hard to provide for them.

Lucena has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, soy sauce, shampoo, laundry soap, etc. 

Lucena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Gemma

Ma. Gemma has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods.
Ma. Gemma aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

Em-Em has been in this business for one year now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Em-Em would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

Jenie requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Jenie has been in this business for 21 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business.

In the future, Jenie would like to repair and improve her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

Nilda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Nilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Elmar has been sustaining her business activities through the past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Jerlie has been in this business for two years. Jerlie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan in the amount of PhP 9,000 to further build her business. She will use her loan funds to buy items to sell in her general store, such as soap, sugar, rice, eggs, shampoo, and grocery items.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

Porferia has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 24,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Her goal is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

She dreams of saving enough money to allow her to be able to afford to send her children to college.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.
